description: From ἴδιος (ídios, “own, personal, distinct”) + ῥῠθμός (rhuthmós, “rule, measure, rhythm”).

adjectives.description: idiorrhythmic (comparative more idiorrhythmic, superlative most idiorrhythmic)

entries.meaning: (Christianity) self-regulating; usually referring to a form of monastic life where monks live alone, often in isolation, constantly in mental prayer
